abstract: The automaker is trying to fend off a rising tide of class-action lawsuits stemming from its recall of 2.6 million cars because of a dangerously defective ignition switch that it now links to 13 deaths.
snippet: The automaker is trying to fend off a rising tide of class-action lawsuits stemming from its recall of 2.6 million cars because of a dangerously defective ignition switch that it now links to 13 deaths.
lead_paragraph: An unusual meeting took place this week at a law office high in a Times Square skyscraper. Lawyers from about 100 law firms participated, either in person or by phone. The agenda: solidifying a strategy for taking on General Motors in bankruptcy court.

headline.main: Hoping to Fend Off Suits, G.M. Is to Return to Bankruptcy Court
headline.print_headline: Hoping to Fend Off Suits, G.M. to Return to Bankruptcy Court

byline.original: By Hilary Stout and Bill Vlasic
